slides.title: Welcome to Pollution
slides.content:
# Introduction to Pollution

Welcome to **Pollution** - understanding environmental contamination!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Air Pollution** - Atmospheric contaminants
- **Water Pollution** - Aquatic contamination
- **Soil Pollution** - Land contamination
- **Solutions** - Prevention and cleanup

> **Fun Fact:** Air pollution causes more deaths annually than car accidents!

slides.title: Air Pollution
slides.content:
# Air Pollution

## Major Pollutants:

| Pollutant | Source |
|-----------|--------|
| CO | Combustion |
| SO2 | Coal burning |
| NOx | Vehicles |
| Particulates | Industry, fires |
| Ozone (O3) | Secondary (smog) |
| VOCs | Solvents, fuels |

## Effects:
- Respiratory disease
- Acid rain (SO2, NOx)
- Smog
- Ozone depletion
- Climate change

## Indoor Air:
- Radon
- Formaldehyde
- CO from stoves

slides.title: Water and Soil Pollution
slides.content:
# Water and Soil Pollution

## Water Pollutants:

| Type | Source |
|------|--------|
| Pathogens | Sewage |
| Nutrients | Agriculture |
| Heavy metals | Industry |
| Pesticides | Farming |
| Oil | Spills |
| Plastics | Everywhere |

## Eutrophication:
- Excess nutrients (N, P)
- Algal blooms
- Oxygen depletion
- Dead zones

## Soil Contamination:
- Heavy metals
- Pesticides
- Industrial waste
- Affects food safety

slides.title: Solutions
slides.content:
# Pollution Solutions

## Prevention:
- Cleaner technology
- Reduce consumption
- Substitute less harmful materials

## Control:
- Emission limits
- Treatment facilities
- Filters, scrubbers

## Remediation:
- Soil cleanup
- Water treatment
- Bioremediation

## Policy:
- Clean Air/Water Acts
- International agreements
- Cap and trade

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Pollution Summary

## Types:
| Medium | Key Pollutants |
|--------|---------------|
| Air | CO, SO2, NOx, PM |
| Water | Nutrients, pathogens |
| Soil | Heavy metals, pesticides |

## Key Issues:
- Climate change
- Acid rain
- Eutrophication
- Microplastics

## Solutions:
- Prevention > Control > Cleanup
- Regulation and policy

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Pollution!
